newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine stock exchange cuts fees on options.
newsitem.headline: Argentine stock exchange cuts fees on options.

text.p: Argentina's Buenos Aires Stock Exchange said Friday it will reduce the fees on stock options to 0.10 percent from 0.20 percent on June 13.
The exchange said the reduction was part of its policy to cut operating costs to increase the competitiveness of the market.

The measure was adopted "considering that options' activity has so far not seen any reduction, and because it is certain that options market growth will boost the spot market," the bolsa said in a statement.
The reduction has been approved by the local securities and exchange commission.
